page.title: 15Farleigh Church(contd.)
page.content: Outside there is a graveyard with new and old grave stones.Two benches stand there,one which is in memory of an old member.Long grasses lead round to the left where a Â£hall' is separate from the main building.Outside the porch,on the left there is an old iron, boot or shoe scraper where people would scrape mud and dirt off their shoes before they enter the church.The narrow windows were the style of the Normans. The chancel has two candles and a sparkling clean cloth.A wooden rail above the step is used for communion. Below the steps are long cushions with a tapestry covering.The floor is made of wood.The chancel pews have beautiful delicate carvings,which would have been carved by hand by a skilled craftsman. One of the grave stones has been in the graveyard since 1486.
